title: FILE SCANNING WHINGING BYPASS
body:
STOP WHINING ABOUT THE FILE SCANNING..........................................
Don't know how many times I've told people a quick way around it so here it is again...............................

WINDOWS 8 ------------------------ Task manager, Right click patcher > go to details, Right click patcher again > set priority to high.... To all the patcheres and client I thnk its like 5 or more patchers running same time.....
MACS >>>>> ur shit out of luck I cant help you sorry.. :)

PS it still scans couple thousand files but it only takes a couple minutes not 30 :)

replies.body:
>MACS >>>>> ur %%%% out of luck I cant help you sorry.. :)

lol

Doesn't Mac have any sort of task monitor? Any OS worth its salt would allow you to see the currently running processes.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=k1A48lEk,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-02-13T23:07:04.262+0000)
>
> lol
> 
> Doesn't Mac have any sort of task monitor? Any OS worth its salt would allow you to see the currently running processes.

as far as im aware wich im not its similar to the CMD prompt in windows.... with like 

tasklist and find out PID or IM of the process 
wmic process where name="LoLPatcher.exe" CALL setpriority "high priority"

but like I said..... no idea with mac just research it

Ah, oki doki. As long as there's a terminal or command prompt then you should be able to do something like that. I don't use Mac myself, but hopefully when someone Google searches this problem and comes across this discussion, they'll see what can be done about it.
